root: ^It’s important to set goals for yourself. Without goals, you’re just drifting. Do you have any goals right now?

s: ^I want to graduate and get a job that helps me leave this place.
^I don’t really have any goals. I’m just trying to get through the day.

Graduate_Job: ^That’s a solid goal. What kind of job are you aiming for?

s: ^Something in engineering, maybe. I like building things.
^I’m not sure yet, but I’ll figure it out.

Engineering: ^That’s a great goal. Engineering can open many doors for you.

s: ^Could you help me set up a plan to achieve this?

Not_Sure_Yet: ^That’s okay. What matters is that you’re thinking about the future.
No_Goals: ^That’s dangerous thinking. If you don’t have goals, you’re letting life happen to you. Why don’t you have any goals?

s: ^I don’t see the point. Nothing ever changes here.
^It feels like setting goals won’t matter.

Nothing_Changes: ^Nothing changes because too many people think like that. Be different.
No_Matter: ^Every goal matters. Without them, you’ll never move forward.
Start_Teacher_Goal_Quest: ^Alright, let’s break it down. First, what’s one thing you can do now that will help you work towards this goal?

s: ^I could study harder and focus on science and math.
^I’m not sure. It all feels overwhelming.

Study_Hard_Plan: ^That’s a great start. Focusing on your studies will set you up for success in engineering. Keep going, and you’ll see the results.
Overwhelmed_Plan: ^It’s okay to feel overwhelmed. Start small—one step at a time. Even small actions will add up.
Complete_Teacher_Goal_Quest: ^You’re on the right path. Remember, goals are achieved one step at a time. I’ll be here to support you.
